profileAlternative.name: John Andrews
profileAlternative.headline: Business Applications Manager at Consumers Mutual Insurance of Michigan
profileAlternative.summary: I am currently the Business Applications Manager for Consumers Mutual Insurance since June 2015. I am responsible for SQL Server administration and development, business systems analysis and project management activities which include planning, designing, implementing and maintaining business applications. I have over 16 years of experience building enterprise level database applications, 5 of those years in the health care industry. I am an active member of the Greater Lansing Area for SQL Server user's group. I served for 7 years in the U.S. Army and National Guard in Germany, Oklahoma, and Michigan. I received a Bachelor of Science in Anthropology with a focus on Archaeology and Museum Studies from Central Michigan University. I am also a writer with two archaeology publications and am in the process of writing my first novel: The Pendant.

positions.title: Consumers Mutual Insurance of Michigan
positions.description:
• Manage Development team.
• Manage multiple vendors and projects to ensure timelines are met and completed within budget.
• Work with department staff to document company business systems and processes.
• Designed and built two custom enterprise applications for Provider and Member management.
• Create and manage company SQL Server (2008/2012) databases.
• Research and evaluate third-party software and make recommendations based on business needs and budgetary constraints.
• Collaborate with CIO in writing RFPs and selecting vendors for multiple projects.
• Coordinate data transfers between Third Party Administrator (TPA) and 18 other vendors.
• Design website modules and manage vendors to ensure completion of projects within budget.
• Work with internal and external clients for import and normalization of third-party data.

roles.title: Business Applications and SQL Server Manager

positions.title:
Title
Senior SQL Server and Applications Developer
positions.description:
• Developed and managed company SQL Server (2008/2012) databases.
• Created databases, tables, stored procedures, functions, views and SQL Server Jobs.
• Optimized database performance through query analysis, table design and indexing.
• Worked with internal and external clients for import and normalization of third-party data originating from multiple data sources/types.
• Built and maintained SQL scripts, indexes, and complex queries for data analysis, data extraction, transform, and load (ETL) using SSIS and Transact SQL (T-SQL).
• Added and deleted database users and create user roles to manage user permissions.
• Managed database availability/backup strategies, database maintenance plans and restoration of data.
• Managed multiple SQL Server environments.
• Analyzed business processes and recommend solutions.
• Development of company's proprietary applications using MS Access.
…
see more

positions.title: Health Information Systems Developer
positions.description:
• Managed Data Services team.
• Interviewed and hired staff/performed verbal and written counseling and job appraisals.
• Directed and participated in the development of company's proprietary .Net and MS Access applications.
• Developed company's proprietary applications using Visual Studio 2008, ASP.NET, VB, T-SQL, and MS Access.
• Responsible for all aspects of .Net application development to include project management, user interfaces, business logic/analysis, deployment and SQL database design.
• Collaborated with departmental users to automate business processes and routine functions.
• Documented application and database requirements.
• Conducted user training and created user manuals for company’s proprietary applications.
• Created and managed company SQL Server (2005/2008) and Access databases.
• Built and maintained SQL scripts, indexes, and complex queries for data analysis, manipulation, import and extraction of data using SSIS and Transact SQL (T-SQL).
• Administered multiple SQL Server environments: Production, Development and Testing.

positions.title: Information Systems Manager
positions.description:
• Managed development team in converting the company’s proprietary enterprise application from MS Access to ASP.NET.
• Interviewed and hired staff and contractors.
• Created company’s enterprise application in MS Access and SQL Server2000/2005.
• Responsible for all aspects of application development to include project management, user interface and business logic/analysis.
• Responsible for SQL Server database design, maintenance, optimization, indexing, and backup strategies.
• Data extraction, transform, and load (ETL) using Transact SQL (T-SQL), DTS and SSIS.
• Managed multiple SQL Servers: Production, Development, Backup, Financial and Sales.
• Managed database availability/backup strategies including transaction log shipping, database mirroring, database maintenance plans and restoration of data as needed.
• Led company focus groups to identify business needs and inefficiencies.
